comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Major Alexander Alderson Anderson born Sep 23, 1889. Son of Lt. Col. W. P. Anderson, 64 Cooper Street, Ottawa, Ontario. Trade or Calling: Civil Engineer. Single. 6 ft 1 in. Mentioned in despatches. www.canadiangreatwarproject.com/searches/soldierDetail.as... Appears in a photo of the Original Officers of the 2nd Canadian Divisional Signal Company - Ottawa 1915 www.canadiangreatwarproject.com/general/image.asp?imageId... Journal of the Engineering Institute of Canada reports on Major A. A. Anderson, Jr.E.I.C. giving a talk April 15, 1921— on Richibuctu Breakwater. He was a member of the Border Cities Branch of EIC. Alexander Alderson Anderson, (Grad. R.M.C. Kingston), B.Sc. (McGill Univ.,), asst. engr., chief engr's branch, London District, Dept. P.W., London, Ont. Assoc Member EIC 1921.
